paper.title: Error Mitigation by Symmetry Verification on a VQE

comparisons.description: H2 ground state energy at equilibrium (R=0.735 A)

emulator.failure_description: Replication matches published results within error bars

tuna9.failure_description: q[4,6] with Z-parity post-selection + readout error mitigation. Significant improvement over previous q[0,1] result (-1.00448 Ha, 83.35 kcal/mol). New qubit pair and mitigation pipeline reduce error from 83.35 to 6.2 kcal/mol.

ibm_torino.failure_description: Hardware noise degrades Z correlations by 3-5%. Correct parity sector maintained.

comparisons.description: Symmetry verification reduces VQE error vs raw noisy measurement

tuna9.failure_description: Z-parity post-selection improved error from 22.2 kcal/mol (raw) to 7.2 kcal/mol (3.1x). Adding readout error mitigation further improved to 6.2 kcal/mol (3.6x total improvement). Published claims >2x; we observe 3.6x, which exceeds the published improvement factor. PASSES.

comparisons.description: VQE achieves chemical accuracy (< 1.6 mHa) with error mitigation

emulator.failure_description: Replication matches published results within error bars

tuna9.failure_description: Hardware noise degrades result but qualitative behavior preserved

ibm_torino.failure_description: Hardware noise degrades result but qualitative behavior preserved

summary.notes: Tuna-9 results updated 2026-02-10 with q[4,6] + Z-PS + readout mitigation. VQE energy improved from 83.35 to 6.2 kcal/mol. Symmetry verification claim now PASSES (3.6x improvement vs published >2x).
